common_issues.title: PiecesOS Launch Failure Across Platforms
common_issues.description: Users report PiecesOS failing to launch on macOS and Windows after recent updates. Issues include dependency errors, long boot times, and stricter hardware requirements. Solutions involve using specific OS builds (Apple Silicon for M1 Macs), waiting for new releases addressing hardware compatibility, and providing logs to the support team for diagnosis.

related_issues.title: Cannot launch pieces-for-developers after new installation on MacOS Sequoia 15.2 M1 chip
related_issues.text:
Cannot launch pieces-for-developers after new installation on MacOS Sequoia 15.2 M1 chip
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I cannot install pieces Desktop App, or it fails to run.  I originally reported this by email on 9 Jan 2025, and the response email referred to an existing issue on github #546.  However this issue now seems closed, hence I am raising it here as a new bug.
 
I have recently installed pieces OS on my Mac with a package dmg.  The pieces OS appears to install, and I see the icon in the top bar.  Pieces appears to connect to the cloud successfully, and I can install plugins for Intellij, VSCode and Obsidian.  These are visible within the pieces OS icon at the top.  
 
Pieces appears to work from IDE plugins.   However I cannot launch the Desktop App, and ‘launch pieces for developers’ from the top Pieces menu fails silently.

I have recently upgraded Pieces OS, now on 11.1.1
 
Info:
 
Mac OS: Sequoia 15.2
Chip: Apple M1 Pro
 
Pieces OS: 11.1.1 (was installed as 11.0.3(
Pieces desktop app – won’t install
Pieces OS seems to be running in ‘activity monitor’
## Summary of GitHub Issue #621

**Key Points Raised:**

* PASimmons reported an issue with PiecesOS not running on their M1 Mac.
* The support bot suggested helpful resources and related issues.
* Mark, from the Pieces team, offered troubleshooting steps.

**Problems Identified:**

* PiecesOS wouldn't run on the user's M1 Mac.
* The previous build worked on both Arm and Intel, but this is no longer the case.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Mark suggested:
    * Killing the `pieces_qdrant_server` process.
    * Providing the `com.pieces.os` support logs.
    * Double-checking the download and using the correct build for M1 Macs.
* PASimmons reinstalled Pieces using the Apple Silicon download link, and it worked.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue is resolved.
* Users with M1 Macs need to use the Apple Silicon build of PiecesOS. 
* An announcement is being made about this change in issue #615.

related_issues.title: PiecesOS takes a while to boot-up(cannot run): (Unable to make it past ensure core dependency in the Desktop application)
related_issues.text:
PiecesOS takes a while to boot-up(cannot run): (Unable to make it past ensure core dependency in the Desktop application)
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

3.3.5

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I got a popup that there was a new version of Pieces OS and that I needed to click and restart to update. But now the desktop app won't start anymore, being stuck on the core dependencies.

I can click on the link, but nothing changes when I do that.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/716af38b-6a71-4162-80f8-b9e9e44f7059)
## Summary of GitHub Issue Discussion: PiecesOS Takes a While to Boot-up (Unable to Make it Past Ensure Core Dependency in the Desktop Application)

**Key Points Raised:**

* Users are experiencing issues with PiecesOS taking a long time to start up and getting stuck on the "ensure core dependency" step.
* The issue appears to be more prevalent with users in certain locations and with machines that have older processors.
* Users have tried restarting the application and their computers, but the issue persists.

**Problems Identified:**

* Major migration of data to a new stack is causing delays in the startup process.
* Self-signed certificates are causing handshake errors in the client.
* Older processors may not be able to handle the updated application.
* Onedrive is causing conflicts with the application's database.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* The Pieces team has released a new build (11.1.1) that addresses the data migration issue.
* The team is working on a solution for the certificate issue.
* Users with older processors are encouraged to try the appInstaller build.
* The team has identified a conflict with Onedrive and is working on a patch to prevent it.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The new build (11.1.1) seems to have resolved the issue for some users.
* The team is still working on solutions for other users.

**Further communication:**

* Users are encouraged to report any further issues and updates in the same thread.
* The team will keep users informed of the progress on the remaining issues.

## Additional Notes:

* This issue was originally reported for Windows, but there were also reports of similar issues on macOS.
* The team is working on resolving the issue for all platforms.

* The issue was caused by an avx2 incompatibility in the new vector library.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* A fix for the avx2 issue was scheduled for release the next day.
* The user was asked to test the new release with the fix.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The status of the issue is unclear after the user provided their CPU information.

* The conversation took place on February 13th, 2025.
* Several team members from Pieces were involved in the conversation.

## Summary of GitHub Issue Discussion: PiecesOS Takes a While to Boot-up (Unable to Make it Past Ensure Core Dependency in the Desktop Application)

**Key Points Raised:**

* Users are experiencing issues with PiecesOS taking a long time to start up and getting stuck on the "ensure core dependency" step.
* The issue appears to be more prevalent with users in certain locations and with machines that have older processors.
* Users have tried restarting the application and their computers, but the issue persists.

**Problems Identified:**

* Major migration of data to a new stack is causing delays in the startup process.
* Self-signed certificates are causing handshake errors in the client.
* Older processors may not be able to handle the updated application.
* Onedrive is causing conflicts with the application's database.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* The Pieces team has released a new build (11.1.1) that addresses the data migration issue.
* The team is working on a solution for the certificate issue.
* Users with older processors are encouraged to try the appInstaller build.
* The team has identified a conflict with Onedrive and is working on a patch to prevent it.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The new build (11.1.1) seems to have resolved the issue for some users.
* The team is still working on solutions for other users.

**Further communication:**

* Users are encouraged to report any further issues and updates in the same thread.
* The team will keep users informed of the progress on the remaining issues.

## Additional Notes:

* This issue was originally reported for Windows, but there were also reports of similar issues on macOS.
* The team is working on resolving the issue for all platforms.
